text:
Good morning everyone :wave:  (or good *insert whatever is more appropriate for your timezone* :blush:)
We're considering moving our blog to Webflow (it's on Prismic + Gatsby right now and we don't have the dev resources to keep it updated) and I'm looking for feedback. Is anyone running their website + blog on webflow too? Any downsides we should consider before moving forward?

elements.text: Good morning everyone
(or good *insert whatever is more appropriate for your timezone*

)
We're considering moving our blog to Webflow (it's on Prismic + Gatsby right now and we don't have the dev resources to keep it updated) and I'm looking for feedback. Is anyone running their website + blog on webflow too? Any downsides we should consider before moving forward?

text:
I used webflow in my earlier company. Those were dark days I would say :stuck_out_tongue:

The app is slow and takes lot of time.  Marking links as DoFollow and NoFollow became a major task for me.  Its also complex compared to WordPress.

elements.text: I used webflow in my earlier company. Those were dark days I would say
The app is slow and takes lot of time.  Marking links as DoFollow and NoFollow became a major task for me.  Its also complex compared to WordPress.

text:
Hey <@U032D7Y0658>! We have just moved our website from Prismic to WebFlow! We did have a designer set it up for us and I usually live in the contributor mode so don’t have access to the “code-y bits”.

I’m finding it pretty straightforward so far to upload blogs etc. For me, it’s just a case of putting in the copy, select whatever I want as H1, H2 headers etc., linking the relevant stuff, and filling in the relevant info (e.g. thumbnail and any other fields).

elements.text: Hey

! We have just moved our website from Prismic to WebFlow! We did have a designer set it up for us and I usually live in the contributor mode so don’t have access to the “code-y bits”.

text:
<@U01J3L8CJRL> we've moved away from wordpress as it was too slow. I'll look into the DoFollow and NoFollows!

<@U02ANC57AAY> we'll have a designer set it up for us too so should be good there. I see you've set up your site in French and English too. Are you using Weglot or did you create 2 projects (one for each language)? Can you share a screenshot of what contributor mode looks like? (maybe in dm if you're more comfortable?) Congrats on the new podcast by the way!

elements.text: we've moved away from wordpress as it was too slow. I'll look into the DoFollow and NoFollows!

we'll have a designer set it up for us too so should be good there. I see you've set up your site in French and English too. Are you using Weglot or did you create 2 projects (one for each language)? Can you share a screenshot of what contributor mode looks like? (maybe in dm if you're more comfortable?) Congrats on the new podcast by the way!

text:
Ah yes - we’re using Weglot but I must admit, trying to cater to two languages has been a bit of a nightmare!

As we still wanted some blogs in French for SEO, we’ve ended up having to translate all French articles into English so all articles are on the website in English. BUT we then manually add a French version which can appear for search as the automatic translation doesn’t translate to the standard we want to maintain at this stage… So we may have to pay a freelancer to translate the blogs we create and then manually add them. We’re still working out what is the best solution… :sweat_smile:

Sure - I’ll DM you some screenshots :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks! The podcast is a lot of work but good fun and hopefully valuable for our audience!

elements.text:

text: I'm using Webflow for the first time now (I've always been in WordPress). I wouldn't do it unless I had a developer/frontend designer on-hand to make little tweaks you need here and there. A lot of what's there by default in WordPress has to be customized in Webflow (e.g. adding title tag/meta description fields)

text: Hey Eric, so lovely to see your face pop up! Hope you've been well. Would you mind sharing an overview of your Notion set up? I was considering Notion to replace Airtable as our WIP hub, but wasn't sure if editing written content in Notion has the same flexibility at G Docs.

elements.text: Hey Eric, so lovely to see your face pop up! Hope you've been well. Would you mind sharing an overview of your Notion set up? I was considering Notion to replace Airtable as our WIP hub, but wasn't sure if editing written content in Notion has the same flexibility at G Docs.

text: Whoa! Happy to be wrong. And looks like I have something to go to my platform of choice about now!!!

elements.text: Whoa! Happy to be wrong. And looks like I have something to go to my platform of choice about now!!!

text: Notion recently added a great QOL feature that allows you to select text without selecting the whole block that has made editing a lot less annoying. :pray:

elements.text: Notion recently added a great QOL feature that allows you to select text without selecting the whole block that has made editing a lot less annoying.

text: I still do actual blog writing in Google docs because it's less finicky. But we manage documentation and our workflow in Notion.
